thread.title: The Pulse: Adelaide’s live news, weather and traffic blog | The
thread.title_full: The Pulse: Adelaide’s live news, weather and traffic blog | The Advertiser

author: Michael Ramsey
title: The Pulse: Adelaide’s live news, weather and traffic blog | The
text:
CONDITIONS have eased in Adelaide but severe weather will continue in other parts of the state today, with almost 800 homes still without power.
SA Power Networks is reporting outages in the towns of Karte, Kringin, Parilla, Peebinga and Pinnaroo near the Victorian border.
A severe weather warning has been issued today for people in the Lower Eyre Peninsula, Eastern Eyre Peninsula, Yorke Peninsula, Kangaroo Island, Flinders, Mid North and parts of the West Coast, North West Pastoral and North East Pastoral districts.
Gusts of more than 90km/h are possible over the Eyre Peninsula early this morning before moving north-east in the hours to follow.
People in the warning areas should move their cars under cover and away from trees, secure loose items and stay indoors while conditions are severe.
The weather bureau is predicting rainy and windy weather in Adelaide today with a top of 13°.
WILD WEATHER ACROSS SA
- There were more than 8000 homes without power during the peak of the storm, with the majority of outages in Port Augusta.
- Damaging winds were recorded in several parts of the state, including gusts of 96km/h at Hindmarsh Island, 95km/h at Port Lincoln and 93km/h at Marree.
- Winds briefly reached gale force at Port Augusta with gusts to 87 km/h.
- The SES responded to dozens of call-outs, mainly for trees down in the Adelaide Hills. One house in Old Reynella was flooded, while a tree fell on Strathalbyn Rd in Flaxley but there were no major traffic problems.
- There were reports that Mount Bryan in the state’s mid-north received 1.5cm of snow but there was none reported in Mount Lofty.
The Pulse has this story covered, plus other breaking news, sports, traffic and weather updates.
Join the conversation by tweeting us using the hashtag #newsADL or leaving a comment below.
Remember, if you can’t find the story you’re looking for, scroll down.
We’re blogging live until 10am.
